text: Bottle at Cafe 21. IBU is 35 according to the bottle. Cant add that info through the app. Amber color, white curtains /head. Vigorous pour by the server. Well... Aromas of caramel, citrus. Medium bitter, light sweet. Medium fullness, long aftertaste of bitterness like a grapefruit.
Nice Golden amber colour, white foam. Caramel but also a bit citrussy. Bitter and dry, some sweetness. Definitely a beer I will drink more in the future.

Hazy amber body with a medium to large off white head. Aroma is caramel, light fruity, hoppy, syrup. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body, soft to average carbonation, oily texture, bitter finish.
Flaska @ Eastwood, Amsterdam. Klar bärnstensfärgad med ett smutsvitt skum. Dofter av malt, karamell och citrus. Smakinslag av malt, karamell, nöt, citrus och tall. Nötig och besk avslutning.
Flesje gedeeld met familie bij de Bomkelder. Amberkleurig troebel bier. Kruidig aroma. Smaak is kruidig en hoppig. Nasmaak is bitter en ebt langzaam weg.
Fles gedeeld door BartvG, geprobeerd met Inoven en JoepvW. Het is een licht amberkleurig bier met een volle schuimkraag. Het heeft een bittere smaak met een iets zoetje.

Bottle 33 cl / zBierhuus - Münsingen (CH). Coppery beer with a nice off-white head, fine sparkling and laces. Malted aromas, bread, caramel, fruity of orange-citrus. The taste is powerful, syrupy of malt and caramel-toffee with a hop with notes of citrus and herbs, bread spread with bitter orange jam. Not so far from Barley Wine.
HAMMERGESÖFF!!! Sour Red Nose trifft extrem splittrigen Malzbitterhopdrytrunk. Exorbitant extravagant. LOVE!!! 0,33l Flasche von einem MITRA in Tilburg. 2,50!?

Bottle: 330 ml, Price: 0,99 eur 
Visai patiko.
KØLF 240916. Amber color with a beige head.Aroma is caramel, yeast, malt, hop, . Flavor is fruit, malt, hop, caramel, yeast. Medium body. OK beer.
Bottle. Golden color with fine white foam. Aroma: sweet, malt, floral hop, a little alcohol. Taste: sweet, malt, alcohol and medium hop bitterness.

- Bernsteinfarben mit guter, cremiger Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach Bitterorangenschalen, tropischen Früchten, Malz und Karamell
- passende Carbonisierung
- der Antrunk überrascht mit einer Hopfenbitternis, welche die aufgerufenen Aromen nicht vermuten lassen
- der ganze Körper bzw. die Textur ist durchgängig sehr ausgewogen
- im Mittelteil schwingt eine leichte malzige Süße passend im Hintergrund mit
- gegen Ende noch eine angenehme Beigabe von etwas Mandel und Kokos
Fazit: Wunderbar ausgewogenes Lager

330 ml bottle. Unclear orange body with a dense, lacing tan head. Aroma has malt, toffee and ripe fruit. Flavor is sweetish malty, toffee, fruit and moderate bitterness. Medium body and average aftertaste. Drinkable but quite straight forward.
Tap. Clear golden with white top. Light slightly sour aroma. Light refreshing malty taste.
Bottle @ bar in Breda. Golden amber colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Caramel, biscuits, citrussy. Bitter and dry, some sweetness. Ok beer.

Proefglas van 33cl-fles op Nederlandse bieren-tasting van H.O.P. in Gainsbar te Kortrijk. U: Wazig oranje met een witte schuimkraag. G: Floraal, licht hoppig en een beetje perzik. S: Licht moutzoet, een hopbittertje, wat gist en mandarijn. Droge afdronk. M: Dorstlesser met medium carbonatie.

Amberkleurig bier met witte schuimkraag. Geur: geparfumeerd, bloemen. Smaak: bitter, fruitig en ietwat moutzoetigheid, 1 fruitig component bevalt me niet al weet ik niet wat. Medium volmondig en koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: droog bitter.
UPDATED: NOV 2, 2016 Bottiglia 33cl. Bel colore ambrato chiaro con ricca schiuma bianca. Aroma di malto, erbacea con note fruttate in bocca. Carbonazione media, ottima.

Light amber color which could be a little more clear as vienna lagers require, with a wonderful creamy and long lasting foam. Aroma of european noble hops (maybe EKG or Styrian G.), caramel and malty notes, some of which tend to be ta little bit toasty. Good balance between sweet and bitter. Medium body. Average carbonation. Bitter finish. You know, its not supposed to have the complexity of a RIS or a belgian, but its made so fine, without any single defect, and its so pleasant and drinkable that it deserves it all. So good!

Bottle. Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, some herbs, fruitiness and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and malty with some herbs, bitterness and fruitiness. Medium body, average carbonation.
Bottle at home, orange/amber beer, small/medium head. Aroma is malt, citrus/hoppy, Taste is the same long dry aftertaste, not bad

Orange-amber colour, with a medium head that has a good retention and leaves a good lace. Aroma of caramel, with some citrics notes. Medium body, creamy palate and OK carbonation. TAste of caramel, malts, notes of citrus and fruits. OK.

Sampled from tap at the brewpub. Clear, dark amber with an off-white head. Sweetish, malty and slightly fruity aroma of caramel, honey and some orange jam. Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity taste of caramel, honey, orange jam and a touch of pine, followed by a short, slightly bitter, a little dry finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very pleasant!

Bottle. Pours in light hazy amber body with medium white head. Aroma has clean malty profile with hints of caramel. Taste has upfront strong bitterness balanced with intense caramel crisp sweetness, almost burnt. Body is full, medium carbonation.

hazy orange to amber colour, huge, creamy yellowish-beige-is head, which lasts for several minutes; aroma of orange zest, pine and tropical fruity notes, bread and biscuits; bittersweet taste with the same notes; amazing amber lager!

Robe rousse rubis, limpide à peine troublée.

Parfum floraux, houblonné, léger et poivré.

Le corps est plutôt présent pour le style, on a du biscuit, du léger caramel, rafraichissant sans être trop sec ou trop aqueux.

De bonnes saveurs florales et houblonnées.Sympa.

Tasted on the 06/03/2016 at Barcelona Beer Festival. Last one of the 16´ edition. Amber colour with a medium head. Aroma of caramel, malts and earth. Taste is caramel with some malty notes. Next one please!
Quite clear amber orange color with small lasting head. Aroma is caramel, hops. Flavor is malt, caramel, hops, bitter. Well balanced

33cl bottle, pours clear to slight hazy amber, avg creamy head, half-way lasting
Aroma: hops, caramel, citrus, slightly breadish
Taste: grain, hoppy, citruses and notes of caramel
Palate: medium bodied beer, with soft carbonation, bitter finish
Overall: a very drinkable amber lager, enjoyed!
33cl bottle from firma bier. Clear copper color. Medium white head. Light to medium sweetness, light to medium bitterness. Aroma is malty, hoppy. Quite pleasant.

Bottle: Deep golden to light amber coloured, hazy, stable mid-sized off-white creamy head; distinctive herbal and nearly grapefruity hoppy nose with a fruity-caramelly background; dryish bitter-sweet flavour, barely medium bodied and a bit tart - but still soft; long and lingering hoppy finish with a caramelly counterpart. Nothing to complain

330ml bottle. Unclear orange color with off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, caramel, grassy, citrusy fruity, light pine, light spicy. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Koper, kruiden, bitter, stroef. Alsof je een hoef likt van een Schotse hooglander, die van t etiket zeg maar.. Backlog from 2015/06/03.

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 24/04/17 Pours light cloudy golden amber liquid, medium frothy tan head, Aroma: light citrus, apricot, nice malty and caramel, bready, Taste: medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light sour, malty, caramel, bready, citrus, lemon peel, lemon grass, apricot, light candy, cherry, Palate: medium body, soft to average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long bitter caramel aftertaste, Overall: fine, enjoyed, very drinkable.

330ml bottle. Minimally milky, amber colour with average to huge, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Mellow malty, fruity, hoppy aroma, diffuse fruitiness, pome, berries, hints of citrus fruit. Taste is moderately to plentiful sweet caramel malty, citrusy hoppy notes of orange and mandarine, bitter hoppy overtones, minimally peppery spicy hoppy finish; soft carbonation, smooth palate. Nice and simple, a veritable figurehead of the style.

Ambra intenso, mediamente limpida, bella schiuma bianca frizzantina. Aroma di malto e spezie, un po sporco. Eccellente bevuta con ingresso di malto e finale amarognolo di luppolo. Bene la carbonazione. Unottima amber ale.

[9/23/15] Draught at Craft & Draft in Amsterdam. Slightly hazy amber. Aroma of malt, caramel, a bit of candy, and some stale hops. Sweetish flavor with malt, caramel, a bitter hops finish. Medium-bodied.

Ambar, marrón, turbia. Espuma abundante ocre. Aroma ligero. Acaramelado acompañado de alguna leve nota herbal. En boca presenta cierto equilibrio de predominio lupulado aunque la base es acaramelada. Herbal y con notas resinosas. Bien de cuerpo y gas y amargor notable, sobre todo al final.

330ml bottle. Clear amber color. Medium size, yellow head, stays. Caramel, malty, husky, grainy, bit dirty in aroma. Grainy, sweet, caramel, mild hops in taste. Caramel malts and grassy hops in aftertaste. Soft plus bitterness. Sweet and sticky body. Slick mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Average brew.

The new wave of Dutch craft breweries are beginning to tackle every style in existence it seems, in much the same way the American craft beer renaissance highlighted long forgotten styles. This is Maximus take on the American amber lager style, maybe inspired by Brooklyn Lager, a familiar sight in the Netherlands nowadays? Anyway, tasted this at De Goudse Eend in Gouda, thanks Stefan for sharing. Lacing, thick, snow white head, hazy amber robe. Aroma of caramel, dough, wet straw, hint of gin and some burning plastic (perhaps DMTS?). Clean, crisp onset with only some malt fruitiness (not unexpected from a lager, of course), medium carbo, smooth mouthfeel consisting of supple caramelly malts; the American twist, rather than an original Vienna lager character, comes forward in the long, spicy hop bitterness in the end. Interesting beer.

Drinking from tab. 
In the aroma coffee. 
The unclear orange beer has a small white head. 
A nice bitter taste, hop bitterness.
Medium carbonated.

Fľaa 330 ml zo Seoul Plazza Bratislava. Pomarančovo zlatá kalná farba, hustá krémová biela pena, ovocno chmelová vôňa. Stredná rezkosť, príjemne vyváená sladkasto horkastá chuť, ovocie, na konci jemne alkohol.

Bottled 330ml. -from Pivoljub Ljubljana. Pale amber coloured, small off-white head, dusty caramel nose. Moderate malty, caramel, mild fruity and grassy with notes of hops and honey. Rather strong bitter finish. Nothing special here.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2016 
Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, caramel, bread, hops, citrus and grapefruit.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque orange/brown beer with a slight/medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts and caramel; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread, hops, citrus and grapefruit.

0,33l bottle at Brandauers Bierboegen/Wien 19. Well-balanced Pale Ale with a longlasting pleasant mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Lovely maltiness, some caramel, light herbal hops, light pine, ripe fruits. Moderate sweetness with moderate to light bitterness in finish. Decent brew
Aroma: aroma is simple amber vienna combination. Taste is sour vienna, pretty foamy, but

Bottle from Berts Bierhuis. The beer is ocher colored and pours a stable white head, with nice carbonation. Light tones of hops in the aroma, with gives this beer a nice smell of flowers and citrus. In the background some sweet notes of toffee and a hint of nuts. In taste a lot of co2 and hops, further spicy and in the background a light sweetness with tones of raisins. The finish a refreshing bitterness which stays for a while and beside that some nice notes of roasted malts.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear amber with a small white head and an aroma of bitter hops, dry malts, toffee, bread and candy. The taste is slightly to medium sweet with high bitterness that lasts medium-long. Pretty nice beer!
Clear amber (duh), strong white head. Malty caramel and noble hop nose. Bittersweet with malty notes. Finishes bitter and dry. Okay, perhaps a very good example of the style? Eh?

Bottle 0.33 l, 6. Wrocławski Fwstiwal Dobrgo Piwa, Wrocław, Poland.
Ciemnobursztynowe piwo o puszystej pianie oraz łagodnym, słodowym zapachu. W smaku gęste i pełne, początkowo słodowe a następnie z przyjemną, wyrazistą, chmielową goryczką.

On bottle from Bierkonig, Amsterdam- April 2015. Slightly hazy deep golden color, good foam. Medium aroma intensity; hops, malt, grapefruit, citrus and some dried fruit. Medium body & complexity. High bitterness, balances well. Very enjoyable

Apariencia: De color cobrizo, aspecto limpio y con una amplia capa de cremosa capa de espuma.
Aroma: Dulce dulce y de carácter maltoso, con notas a cereal y un ligero punto cítrico.
Sabor: De marcado amargor, con notas que me hacen recordar las malta tostada y el pan recién hecho.
Mooie troebele kleur in het glas met een mooie witte schuimkraag. Bouquette is citrusachtig. Smaak is fruitig met op de achtergrond licht bitter.
33cl @ a bar in Utrecht (The Netherlands). Nice amber lager with malty flavour and fresh nose.

Clear amber beer with a white head, medium carbonation.
Taste is bitter (american) hops, grainy and citrus.
Bitter aftertaste is nice, good beer, with only 6% alc.

Quite nice! Dark amber with a big off white head and pleasant carbonation. Flavor starts slightly sweet floral and malty then the hops take over in a bitter dry aftertaste. The aftertaste is a bit resinous harsh. I had IPAs that were less bitter. All in all a nice easy to drink ale.
Beer tasting with Marius at Café de la Gare. 1st one so blanc taste buts. Good looks, lasting lacing frotty white foam head. Hoppy aroma and nice bitter taste. (Den Haag 201503)
33 cl flesje , redelijk troebel en licht van kleur. Fris fruitige geur. Bij een lijkt het een beetje op "ice tea" maar daarna word de smaak redelijk bitter. Interessant biertje

Heel puik biertje. In eerste instantie veel schuim dat snel wegzakt. Licht troebel. Lekkere stevige bittere nasmaak maar niet te. Niet heel veel geur of frisse tonen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
small bottle sample at a bar some time ago, amber colour with a creamy head, caramel malts, toffee, citrus sourness, crisp malts, not really my taste
Very nice Amber Lager with a heavy aroma of hops. Perhaps one of the most bitter tasting beers from the Netherlands.

The aroma and the colour make you expect a strong, heavy beer. Nothing is less true. Despite its 6%, the body is light and the beer easy enjoyable. American hop varieties dominate the flowery bitter taste. I couldnt retrace the honey aroma in the taste but a descent sweetness is wel present and egalizes the dry character of this beer. An unconventional thirst eraser for the summer as well as a slow-downer in winter. Very interesting stuff!
The definition Amber Lager says nothing about this beer. Its undefinable but definitely something to have at home.
Bottle, 330 ml from Pivoljub, Ljubljana. pours orange with off-white head. Fruity and malty aroma. Caramel, malts, fruit flavor.

Draught @ Hugos. Appearance: pours clean amber with ok soapy beige head and some lacing. aroma/taste: grain/bread, caramel, citrus, grape and floral notes. palette: medium carbonation, medium body, some caramel sweetness, average to distinct bitterness, medium duration and an oily texture. Overall: nice hoppy and refreshing vienna
Słodowy aromat. Miedziany kolor, lekko mętny. Obfita piana, grube bąbelki. Pięknie obkleja szkło. Lekkie ale wyraźne i dość gorzkie. Bardzo przyjemna goryczka. Bardzo pijalne.
Ruikt naar hop en alcohol. Mat amber-kleurig. Iets fruitigs in de smaak. Vrij standaard bier maar wel zwaar van smaak.
Bottle. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty weak hoppy caramel aroma. Fruity malty weak hoppy caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty caramel finish.

Aroma: caramel malts, bread and grains. Appearance: hazy amber, small, off-white head. Taste: light bitter. Plate: ridiculously carbonated, malty grains and bread flavours continue, bitters turning even slightly sour. Overall: this is a poorly brewed beer, the carbonation is completely out of control. Bottle from Wittich Weine, Olten.
Bottle at home. Pours amber with a white head. Aroma of fruity hops, citrus, caramel, sweet malts. Taste is hoppy bitter, sweet malty, fruity. Hoppy bitter aftertaste. Nice.

Draft. An amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of hops, citrus fruits, malt, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, hops, and citrus fruits, leading to a bitter finish.
hazy amber color. fruity, subtle malt aromas, honey, smoky. bitter, medium body. tastes of coffee. bitter / hoppy

Draught Fully hazy ochre-orangey beer with a good dirty yellow, very stable head, leaving textbook lace. Herbal nose, a bit soapy, and repeated wafts of hops. Very aromatic, tasty New World hops, very bitter, even a bit metallic-quinine. Many fruitesters, including banana, passion fruit, bitter orange, grape. Hopoil slickness, light to medium body. Long-lasting hopflavours. Excellent! A discovery.  Doubletake after rating. Vienna??? My left ****
Tap at Craft Bier Fest Wien. Aroma fruity, full caramelly. Clear deep amber colour. Taste again caramel, simply malty. Simple, but good.

Lager très interessante et spéciale.
Un léger arrière gout de houblon, peu structuré, pas longue en bouche (normal ça reste une lager!)
Par contre se marie très bien avec une assiette de charcuterie/fromage.

Bottle from a trade with Cunningham. Deep amber to copper color, tan head. Resin nose, caramel, citrus, floral notes, hints of yeast and fruity esters. Citrus taste, caramel, resin, dry finish. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture.

8th November 2014Hazy amber beer, good cream colour head. Airy palate with decent fine carbonation. Smooth semi dry malt, good creamy sweetness, slightly lactose like. Pinch of spice. Very mild fruits on the back end. Smooth finish. Easy drinking and smooth.
Fruitige geur, bittere smaak. Smaak die blijft hangen. Niet ideaal als laatste biertje daardoor. Mede door zn carbonated mondgevoel.Tis een oke, maar niet indrukwekkend biertje.

Cloudy deep amber color, average sized off white head. Aroma is very fruity. Strawberries and cherries are in front, followed by caramel and some hop notes. Medium body, average carbonation. Nice and easy going. Good beer, excellent lager.
Mooi amberkleurig bier. Geuren van mout, hop, specerijen. Vind dit ook terug in de smaak. Deze is bitter met een lekker lange nasmaak. Lekker biertje als je van bitter houdt.

33cl flesje bij de Boterhal, Breda
Alcoholpercentage van 6%
Uitgeschonken in origineel Maximus Brouwerij glas

Uiterlijk: amberkleurig met mooie witte schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: ebu van 35, flink bittertje dus, fruitig, bloemig

Conclusie: lekker bier, tikkeltje te bitter voor mijn smaak, maar is inherent aan deze stijl

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

25 cl. draft @ t Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Interesting to see this on tap. Dark peach amber with a creamy white head. Nose is weak, mildly sweet, caramel malts, tad other malts. Taste is same sweetish biscuit thick caramel, light brown sugar taste at first as the other blond Maximus beers I have tried so far but that is only how it is upfront. It quickly turns to very bitter harsh hay, very bitter, lots of bitter grass, biscuit, really dries out the mouth. Malty & super-dry body. Decent to good + quite nice to drink overall but not astonishing.
Bottle. Color orange with medium white head. Aroma malt, fruits. Taste crisp, hop, citrus some bitterness.

Not much aroma, very light iron like (in a good way!). Small head, lots of carbonation. Nice little cloudy amber colour. Spivey and bit smokey in the beginning, very well balanced malty and bitter pine hop flavours. Subtle art!

At acbc 
Pours dark amber , good white head . 
smell is fruity , orange , malty , bit sweet , some hops .
Taste is bitter , silky mouthfeel , fruity , perfect carbo , intense at this abv , . Grainy , fruity aftertaste . 
Very impressive
Tap at Fermentoren Århus. Golden with a lasting white head. Great malty aroma with bread and toffee. Sweet malty flavour with a herbal hoppy and decent bitter finish
Draught @ Fermentoren, Århus. Pours hazy golden with a offwhite head. Aorma of malt, caramel, sweet fruit hops, peach. Falvor is malt, caramel, fruity hops. Medium body, soft carboantion. 030914

Bottle 0,33L. Courtesy of Kita. Cloudy, copper colour with average big, off-white, frothy head. Fruity rye aroma. Taste starts medium bitter with a strong sign of American hops and finish medium to heavy bitter. Medium body, oily texture and soft carbonation. Very American Vienna...
Thanks Gitta & Erik;light fruit aroma,amber, cloudy, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, hoppy ,harmonic finish.

330ml bottle bought at the excellent beer store De Bierkoning in Amsterdam. Frothy off-white head that laced well. Next to clear orange coloured body. Moderate aroma of bread and citrus. Malt-fruit flavours, caramel and citrus. Bittersweet fruits to the finish. Well rounded. Nice with fine drinkability (Cabin, MS Serenade 1, 25.07.2014).
Bottle. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Some caramellic notes. Average moderate bitter finish. OK vienna.
# Str. Borup. Light amber coloured and hazy. Has an off-white head, lasting. Nice hoppy aroma. Light grassy notes. Flavor starts light sweet, hoppy too. Finish bitter. Dry texture.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2015 Keg (Leijuva Lahna, Helsinki)
Massive raw grainy cereally aroma, like an organic muesli. Rich amber, small tight off-white head. Taste like the aroma, but even rawer, even more cereally. More organic in the grunge department too. Something bizarrely minty in the taste too. Finish bitter like a cheap artificial sweetener. Im normally a malt head, but this is a mess
Rerate: 330ml bottle ("work" at Koht, Tallinn)
Almost IPA-like aroma. Slightly sticky palat. Odd taste. Improved with more crud. Much better than before, 3.0-3.1, rather fun and interesting.
A clear amber beer with a dense white head. Aromas of hops, oranges, malts. Moderate bitterness of american hops and a malty body. Refreshing, my favorite Maximus.

Keg at PSBH, Manchester. Hazy light amber shade. Fluffy head and lacing. Opens with washes of creamy orange tones before a restrained hop bitterness kicks through. Solid body behind it. Not hugely complex but intriguing in its own way. Not like any amber lager Ive tried to this point, in fact it seems to stand apart from anything else.
Keg @ Port Street Beer House. Pours amber with off-white head. Has a lovely fruity rye taste, well-balanced and smooth with light berries and a bitter finish. This disappeared far too quick!

Pours light hazy amber colour with little white-off head that disappears quickly. Medium mouthfeel, small bubbles with medium + carbonation. Bready and little floral on the nose. Medium bitterness. Very
 Good lager!

Appearance: Light hazy deep golden color with a fine thick off white head. Good lacing.Aroma: Citric hoppy and fruity.Palate: Medium + body. Moderate sweet and a fine bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Citric hoppy, mild grassy, fruity and a fine malty back.Overall impression: Lovely amber ale.Personal stats: Bottle from Maximus Brouwerij in Utrecht, Netherlands.

330 ml bottle. Pours a copper amber colour with a white small head. Aroma of red berries, some nuttiness and fruitcake. Flavour of rich red berries, toffee, grassy bitterness and some herbs. Medium bodied with a soft mouthfeel. Good balance.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2014 Amber with full off-white head. Caramel, nuts, brown bread, fresh cut grass, nice crisp citrus, frozen apple. Medium bodied with crisp lager feel. Nice fruity and tasty but still fresh. Very nice.

Bottle @ Papsø. Pours hazy orange with a lasting and good lacing and white small head. Aroma is hop-spicy nice, appleish, mild pine. Taste is light+ sweet and bitter. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is moderate. Finishes balanced and bitter.
Iets troebele koperen kleur met een volle crème kraag. Ruikt fruitig, hop, kruiden. Smaakt fruitig, zoetig, iets bitter, bloemig.
Flaske, 33 cl, tak Papsøe. Uklar gylden med et cremet hvidt skum. Relativt humlet næse. Toasted malt. Korn. God biterhed. En lille kant af alpha-syre i finish. Sjældent god Amber - med kant.
Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear amber with a dense, creamy and lacing off-white head. Caramellish nose with a little grassyness. Medium body, subtle caramel with a surprisingly bitter finish. 080614

Tap at Craft Bier Fest Wien 2014. Pours amber, nice foam but is gone quite fast. Well carbonated, small bubbles. Aroma has some light hops with caramel malts.Taste is nicely hopped but also has a strong malt base, with a huge malt character. Aftertaste is short and leaving a bit of tartness on the tongue. Overall, interesting session beer, reminds me Sam Adams a bit.

Draught @ Vastarannan Kiiski. Aroma is fruity and malty with caramel. Also some bready tones. Flavour is hoppy and bready with fruits and harsh malt. An unusual combination of bread and hops. Balanced and easy to drink. At the end, hops win.
Lovely Brutus. Well balanced amber lager. Full body, hints of honey, bit smokey. A very good solid beer. Another one please.

(Keg at Black Door, 20140525) The beer poured deep amber and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had malts, molasses and caramel. Palate was medium bodied with quite high carbonation. Flavours were malts, molasses, caramel, grass and bitterness. Aftertaste was malty and bitter. A beer that felt like a mixture of amber ale and dunkler bock and left me confused.
Classy and thick Vienna with a nice combination of fruits and herbs. Caramel and chocolate in the back. Good one.

Bottle 33cl. Clear amber color, good foamy light tan head, mostly lasting turning into fluffy lacing; citrus hops aroma, malts, grass, some caramel, bit of candy sugar; slightly sweet, moderate bitter taste, some pepper on the tongue; medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation; lasting dry bitter finish, bit spicy. Nice beer, for a Vienna style beer not enough sweetness, has more the taste of an IPA.

Earthy hops, bready malts on nose. Med bodied, dry well bittered. Some greens, earthy hops, light grainyness. Feels robust, sort of old-world.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Draught. Pours hazy amber in color with a tan head. Light fruityness, some nuttyness and sweetness in aroma. Nutty bitterness in taste.
Craft bier fest, Vienna. Orange golden color with medium white head. Malty hoppy aroma. Malty taste with light grapefruit hoppy touch. OK

Bottle. amber color, off-white head. Aroma of vanillia, malt, caramel, citrus and citrus peel hops. Flavor is light malty and light caramelic, hints of roasted malt, yeast, resin, citrus hops. More a APA or IPA then a Lager...

Tap at Black Door. Copper color, good off-white head. Berryish, hoppy and malty aroma. Medium-bodied. Nice malty backbone, nutty, a bit caramelly, spicey hoppyness in the finish. Some alcohol kick. All elements are well in balance in this strong beer. I doubt that this is not a lager.
Amberkleur met een dikke witte schuimkraag. Ruikt moutig. Smaakt prima, lekker bitter.
Tap @ Black door. Amber, thin white head. Tropical fruitiness, citrus aroma. Flavor has malt, citrus, hops, toffee. Bitter, caramel finish.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours out of the bottle in a light hazy caramel-amber colour with low head and smooth body. Aroma of vanilla, Belgian yeast and caramel. Taste of hops, barley, cookies, milk, yeast and malt. Smooth finish with caramel hints. Nice one.
Tap at Punavuoren Ahven, Helsinki. Colour is slightly cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, hops, caramel and malts. Amber lager / Vienna?

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with creamy and stable off-white head. Clear aroma of malt, fruit and hops. Bitter, hoppy flavour, with notes of caramel malt and fruit. Bitter, hopy finish. Good mouthfeel. One of the really few decent Amber Lagers I have had.

Bottle at home 
Dark amber - copper color, clear, nice and stable tan foam. 
cereal, citrus, herbs, dough, basement aromas, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, lively, oily feel, slick feel,
At BBF. Amber colour with white head. Hoppy, malt and caramel aroma. Bitter, hoppy and malty taste, maybe some caramel and brown sugar. Light body.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear deep amber color with thin creamy tan-like head, good lacing and sparkling appearance. Aroma of tropical fruits, lemon, yeast, mild caramel and bread. Taste starts with rich moderate sweet malt, follows by refreshing fruitiness with warming mouthfeel, very well balanced and moderate bitter finish. Full body, oily texture and average carbonation in palate. Cant believe in such a thin line between amber lager and IPA. This one reminds me of excellent samples of IPA or APA...
Aroma of malts, caramel, fruits, light citrus hoppiness. Flavour is mostly malty sweetness, some hops present in the aftertaste. Nice and tasty malty brew.
Pours clear gold with medium white head. On the nose we have grass, and grain. Taste is grapefruit, caramel, grass, citrus. Very hoppy, finishes completely dry. Excellent delicious hop-bomb lager.
Gedronken vanuit een 33cl fles, met bijzoonder etiket. Bier smaakt wat bitter, met Fries afdronk. Weinig overtuiging.
amber ferro caramello bruciato discreto amaro pop corn buona nota amara luppolata
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, fruchtig hopfig, exotische Früchte. Geschmack malzig, trocken fruchtig, Karamell, fruchtige Bitterkeit.
Draught. Amber coloured beer. Malty and caramel taste and aroma, along with some hops.

Reddish, medium body, very drinkable. 
Malty aromas, some caramel flavors with a hoppy dry aftertaste.
Very nice beer.
Caña en cimmeria 11-03-2014 en el momento. Color tostado algo turbio. Sabores intensos con amargo final mas o menos seco y persistente. Bastant Buena.

On tap @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 07-03-2014.
In short: a bitter lager.
Pours some hazy amber, with nice creamy off white head. Moderate head retention, good lacing. Malty, spicy, caramel and grassy aromas. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Taste is malty, grassy, some diacetils, caramel, and some hop punch, mild bitterness. Enjoyable.
Bottle. Beautiful amber colour. Rather high carbonation. Feels like a pale ale. Nice.

(bottle, 33cl) Hazy, amber to copper colour with a big and slightly tanned foamy head. Caramel malty, slightly milky aroma with present notes of citric, pineapple-fruity and slightly piney hops. Moderately bitter flavour, medium to light bodied with a moderate carbonation. Mildly cara-malty base with fresh and fruity hoppy notes, getting slightly piney/resiny and spicy towards the bitter and slightly sweet finish. Nice one. 15.II.14

Amber copper colour, medium mokka coloured foamy head, hoppy citrus fruity bitter smell, medium carbonation, medium to high spicy sharp bitter, some citrus peaches fruity tones sticky body tastes and feels like an IPA
Aroma has caramels, colour dark amber, small head. Low carbo. Reaaly bitter one, more than expected, lots of hops. Tropical fruit also. NIce beer, towards an (i)pa

0,33l fles van de mitra. Donker amber met een flinke fijne witte kraag. Geur is citroen van de hop en ook een tikkeltje appart als in bleek. Smaak is mooi bitter met een beetje fruit van de hop, medium body best veel co2. geslaagd biertje.

Ciekawa wersja amber lagera. Wyglad jest piorunujacy, piana spora i utrzymuje sie do konca degustacji. Metne i bursztynowe piwo, chcialo by sie rzec ze to ale bo tak smakuje jest mocno nachmielone, goryczkowe i lekko cytrusowe, w oddali niesmialy karmel. Ciekawe piwo bo chmiel jest tu dominujacy na maxa.

33cl bottle @ home. Clear dark amber color, average off-white head. Aroma light citrus, grapefruit, hops, slight smoke. Taste medium to heavy bitterness, slighly salty. Medium body, average carbonation, long bitter finish. Im bit surprised, this is just like any lager but with stronger taste and more bitterness. In the same time its not very exciting, doesnt have too much flavor except extra bitterness, nor compex aroma.

Bottle 33cl, a clear amber beer with medium head and good lacing. Nose is lemony with hops notes, aroma is again lemony, medium bitter to high, caramel and light toasted notes, difficult to determine its a bottom yeast beer, correct but very near a pale ale.

Bottle 330 ml at home, poured into a stemmed glass. ABV 6%
Pours a bright and deep orange to light amber beer, with a tall off white head. Soapy with thick density. Very good retention. Medium lacing left on the glass.
Aroma of hops, orange peel, a bit funky too, grapefruit. 
Nice bitter taste with lots of hops and flavours of citrus, mandarines, orange peel. Long lasting bitterness on the aftertaste.
Medium thin body, good carbonation with a small bite on the tongue. Mildly dry palate.
Overall a very good beer, when I read amber coloured lager on the label I wasnt expecting much but I was very pleasantly surprised.

On tap at Kafe Belige. Pours a clear amber with a grayish light brown that dissipates slowly to the edges and laces. Aroma has a strong bread and sweet grain note with a touch of grass. Flavor has more grass that works with the grass and has a hint of pine.

Robijn kleurig bier. Veel CO2 schuim kraag is snel dood. Smaak fruitig citrus zeer scherpe smaak ( wit bierscherp)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Draught at Kafé Belgie, Utrecht, 25 July 2013) Amber colour with frothy, beige head. Fruity, malty nose with notes of citrus, grapefruit, resin and caramel. Fruity, hoppy taste with grapefruit, dried apricots, resin, caramel and a fresh, solid bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with balanced sweetness. Excellent modern lager with an impressive hop character. Very nice.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, 33cl. Head: off-white. Colour: clear amber. Aroma: nice hops, malt. Taste: medium bitter-sweet. Palate: bitter-sweet finish, moderate CO2. Overall: nice.

Pretty nice discovery while visiting Utrecht. I didnt know this brewery but they have quite some good beers. Different than the usual watery beers they serve in bars. Nice balance between hops, malts and alcohol. Drinks away nicely , but stays a far to gentle beer..

Bottle. Amber, hazy, average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, some caramel and light fruitiness, light citrus hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, caramel and light bread, light hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, caramel and light bread, faint alcohol. Lightly sweetish vienna with caramel - thats it.
Weird beer, I find it hard to label it. It has some aroma hop, some cara malts and some mild roastiness. Nice and smooth.

Bottle at the ChrisO Pre-GBBF Shindig 2012 - London. Pours clear, orange-amber with a fine white foam head. Bit of caramel and pine in there. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Some pine and grass in the finish, bready malts, subtle wood. Alright.
Bottle. Deep amber beer with a offwhite/tanned creamy head. Hoppy and fruity aroma. Similar flavour with no bitterness = nice :-)

(draught) pours a hazy amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of roasted malts, toffee and raisins, with a hint of herbal hops and heavy resin. flavour is again very resinous, with a hint of cooked vegetables, herbal hops, light toasted malts and caramel. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Draft @ Arendsnest. Amber color with a creamy light beige head. Aroma of caramel malt, citrus, pine and fruity yeast. Flavor is bitter hops balanced with sweet caramel malt and light alcohol. Medium body. Nice beer, the hop bitterness helps balance it out.

RBESG 2013. Draught at Drie Torstige Herten. Golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Fruity hop aroma, citrus, caramel, hay notes, floral, grapes, some mango. Hoppy floral flavor, citrus, perfume notes, biscuits. Nice beer with a lot of flavors.
Poured a medium hazy light reddish brown with a thick off white head. Aroma of caramel malt and sweet citrus. Medium body, flavour quite muted with a dry finish

Red brown colour transparent beer with no carbonation and a weak head.
Mouty smell with lots of resin and leather. Subtle honey sweetness.
Watery bitter taste. No sweetness. Refreshingly dry. Grassy and resinous, almost oily.
Murky amber with a large white head. Not much aroma to be found. Taste is sweet caramel, some pine and a nice bitter finish.

caramel + citrus hop aroma
amber, clear, rocky head, 
light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
light body, average carbonation, bitter finish, 
Great session beer!
Geruch süßlich-getreidig. Start süßlich-getreidig. Mitte mehlig-getreidig, leicht fruchtig, süßlich. Abgang malztönig, süßlich, süßlich, moderat bitter. Geht so.
Dark amber colour with nice lacing. Aroma has caramel malt and a hint of orange. Very nice, smooth mouthfeel. Good, solid hop presence leaving a dry, bitter finish.
Pours dark amber with a white head. Taste is a bit bitter hoppy, caramel, bread, malts and a bit of fruit. Okay beer.
33cl bottle. Great dark beer, with a nice bitterness.

Im pretty sure Ive had this one before, but ratebeer claims otherwise. Dark orange to copper colour with a medium sized off-white head. Smells malty, fresh, grains, blossom. Tastes fresh, bitter, slightly hoppy, some malts and grains. Medium body, nice.carbo. Pretty decent beer.

Bottle:
Medium sized vast and slowly into a fluffy lacing changing ashy beige foamy head on top of a hazy amber colored beer.
Smell hops, citrus, malts, floral herbs and cookies.
Taste is nice hoppy with some bitterness, fruit, grapefruit, citrus, spices, herbs, malts and floral. 
Aftertaste is bitter, floral, light spicy and a hint of malts.
Low carbo, soft creamy light spicy mouthfeel, nice and good medium body and a creamy texture.
Nice beer, balanced and bitter.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 2012 - 12 - 12 330ml bottle. clear amber colour. small white head. leather, hops in aroma. medium bitter taste

Hoppy smell, full and very lasting head, dark amber. Good, promising first impression. But the hops are very dominant, its kind of hard to taste anything else. Bit onedimensional, though its special to drink an amber beer with such dryness, a mix I personally havent seen before.

Bottle at Cafe de la Gare, Den Haag. Lovely clear brown pour with a thin white head. Lovely dry hopped aroma with an amazingly smooth and flavourful  bitter taste and a lovely warm bitterness on the palate. I really liked this beer. Track it down.
Draft at Cafe Belgie.  Pours clear amber with a thick white head.  Aroma of caramel, fruits, herbs.  Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

A kinézete olyan, mint ha egy jó fajta ipával lenne dolgunk. A habja viszont még annál is krémesebb és tartósabb. Illata selyemcukros, csipkebogyós, malátás és kissé komlós. Íze igen malátásan és kissé kukoricásan és karamellásan kezd, aztán szőlősen, komlósan és picit melaszosan folytatódik. Az egész olyan, mintha egy kicsit sokat pihent volna egy öreg pincében. Közepesen testes és moderáltan buborékos. Utóíze keserédes és kissé cukros. Furcsa de nem rossz.

Draught @ Kafe Belgie. Amber coloured. Unclear. Dense beige head. Aroma: Herbs, flowers, caramel, sweeetness and some spice. Flavour: Herbs, sweetness, berries, caramel, some citrus and vague pine. Medium bdoeid. Ends light bitter and fruity.

Tap at Kafe Belgie (probably). The pours deep amber with a small off-white head. The nose is toasted grain, some light caramel and summery herb garden. The taste is lightly buttered brown baked bread, some savoury malt flavors and caramel. Medium body, soft carbonation. Smooth and easy to drink. A decent tipple.

Draught at Kafe Belgie.
Hazy orange coloured with a huge off-white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel, grass, spices, hops and pine needles.
Sweet and fruity flavour of grass, hops and grapefruits.
Sweet, hoppy and spicy finish.

Bottle 330ml.Clear medium amber orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, moderate hoppy, grass, moderate yeasty, leather, fruity yeast, candy yeast. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, candy yeast, caramel. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120803]

bread, toast, grass, citrus, barnyard, dough, clove, amber, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, lively, 


The teast is a big influense in the flavour and taste. Underneath is a hoppy taste that makes it worth your while.
Bottle @ The 5th Danish Summer Gathering, Ulfborg, 2012. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Grain and overripe fruit. Mild yeast and caramel. Bitter fruity finish. Medium bodied.

Draft @ Kafé Belgie, Utrecht. 
Orangée/ambrée, col fin beige.
Arôme sur un bouquet levure, fruité tropical laissant moins de malt prendre le devant par rapport au palais.
Profile bouche, malté allant sur le biscuité/grillé léger, brève note houblonnée, note de grains le tout restant sec en fin de bouche. Léger côté houblonné vient agrémenter le tout mais juste en retrait.

Bottle 330ml @ fonefan
Pours clear deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has note of malt, caramel, floral and citrus.
Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter.
Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. A clear, amber beer topped by a dense, almost creamy, off-white to light beige head. Some lacings left. Citrusy nose with some sugary maltyness in the back. Pleasant bitterness and fruityness in the flavor, with some malty sweetness underneath. Medium body, semi-dry, pleasant carbonation. Rather bitter in the end. A quite pleasant one, but lacking a bit on balance. Not that I care... 120817

Bottle, 6% @ FOneFan, Pre-Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2012. Clear amber with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel and a little hop. Flavour is malt, caramel, hops, hop and a little sweet.
Bottle @ pre-TFODRBSG, Ulfborg. Clear reddish amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 170812
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are sweet malt, caramel, fruits and hops.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ pre-gbbf shindig 2012. Deep amber colour with a mediumsized beige head. Aroma is fruity, floral, mild ripe fruits, earth and some slight bready notes. Flavour is fruity, wooden and mildly floral. Rather bitter in the finish.
33 cl. bottle @ Cafe Olivier, Utrecht. Hazy amber with a white head. Dominant citrus hop aroma with some malts. citrussy bitter taste. Great bitter aftertaste. Another superb summer beer.

Draught @ Kafe Belgie. Hazy orange color, full sized superbly lasting, dense and creamy, off-white head that leaves excellent lacing. Smell malts, light to medium hops, fruityness. Taste malts, hops, very nicely bitter, grapefruit. Very nice beer, ideal on this hot day. Medium body, medium carbonation, very fresh.

Draft @ de Paas. Pours a dark brown coloured beer with a creamy tanned head on top. Aromas of grapefruit, tangerine and fresh hops. Flavour returns a lot of the fruity notes as well as the hop bitterness, making this really nice to drink. Head lasted entire drinking time.
Draft @ Utrechts Bier Brouwers FestivalClear dark amber, off-white head. Pilsener-like aroma and taste but clearly extra hopped which makes it a very nice, easy drinkable thirst quenching beer!
On tap at Arendsnest, Amsterdam. cloudy amber IPA with a medium white-off white head. Rosehip, green leaves and some malt in the nose. Medium body, malt and caramel, light herbal hops.

Amber oranje kleur, veel kraag die snel verdwijnt maar dat kan aan het glas liggen..  Aroma van grapefruit en mout. Smaakt  behoorlijk bitter, citroen,grapefruit. Lange bittere nasmaak. Medium body. Ok bier, iets te bitter naar mijn smaak.

On tap at t Arendsnest. Dark Lager?? IPA, or APA, yes. Clear golden orange colour, dense off white head. Aroma of lots of citrus hops, light pine, some caramel. Flavour is light sweet, malty, hint of caramel, nice fruity hops, particularly citrus, grapefruit, firm dry and bitter finish. Light bodied, soft mouthfeel. Nice.

Tap @ Kafe Belgie. Dark brown colour, dense off-white head. Nose is light malted, bit of toastiness, bit sweet, slightly yeasty. Flavour is light malted, toasty, yeasty, slightly spicy. A bit light bodied.

Dark amber, firm frothy white body. Spices, floral, dark sugar, red fruit, hoppy. Fun combination. Light sweet at first but with a distinctive spicy hop profile. Very nice carbonation to make it drinkable yet flavourful. Bit too dry maybe. Nice brew! (On tap at Kafe België)

Aroma: Sweet malts, citrus hops, fruity. 
Appearance: Clear orange amber with white head. 
Taste: Sweetbitter with a really nice bitter finish. 
Palate: full body, fizzy, bitter. 
Overall: Its nice to discover great dutch craft brews, this is going to be one of my favorites.

A clear yellow/orange colored beer, with a small off white head. The aroma of some sweet malt with hoppy notes, some citrus and grapes. The taste has also sweet malt with hop notes and some fruits. The aftertaste is a little sweet but moving too bitter.
Dark golden body, big white head. Very flowery aroma, with malty notes. The taste wasnt that great, a bit fruity but hoppy finish.

Bottle, 6%. Subtle, but refreshing caramelly hop aroma. Cloudy amber colour. Good stable white head. The flavour is caramelly, from caramelly hops. Good clean bitterness. A subtle beer, but nicely hopped and well-balanced.
33 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden deep orange with a huge off-white head. Aroma is grapefruity and light peachy. Bitter, crisp hoppy, citrusy and grapefruity. Bitter and crisp hoppy finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Malts, caramel and hops aroma. Amber, beige head, good lace. Sweet, bitter, cookies, very hoppy. Full and sticky. Like a 6% Barleywine. Not at all like an IPA.
Bottle. Foamy head. Amber color. Citrus, pepper and caramel in the aroma. Firm citric earthy grassy hopbitter flavor. peppery with hints of caramel. Nice one!
Big white head, nice co2 sizzle. clour is amber and smells a little like citrus. Medium finish. Nice in its style
Nice, grassy yet slightly filthy beer. Not as great as the Pandora but still very nice. Especially the lemony, tingly sensation in the finish. Bottle at the bierhuys in Woerden.

Bottle at Cafe Belgie. Clear dark amber color, tan head with good retention and decent lacing.  Subtle aroma of light grass. Tast is extremely malty, which makes it unbalanced.  Just a tad of bitterness toward the end.  Needs more aroma and bittering hops to call this one an IPA, right now its more or less an amber ale.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2013 33cl bottle from ABCBeers
Creamy white head.  Slightly hazy amber pour.  Very nice bitterness
Bottle @ Kafe Belgie, Utrecht. Amber colored brew. Hoppy aroma, some malts. Flavor is nice, moderate bitterness, some maltyness. Dry.

Bottle @ Kafe Belgie. The aroma is light malty, has grapefruit citric hops. Clear, amber coloured beer with a slight off-white, medium head. The taste is moderate bitter, has some caramel malty sweetness, citric hops dominate. Medium bodied. Some carbonation. Dry. Good.
Bottle from Bierkoning. Dark caramel body with top white head. Nose of hops and toasty malts. Enjoyable taste of caramel, malts and toffee. Good one.
33cl, new exclusive Dutch brewery Anno 2011, from De Bierkoning Amsterdam, complex brew, malty/fruity and slightly bitter, yet easy to drink, balanced, hazy, good head, nice brew
On tap at t Arendsnest. Hazy copper, cream-coloured head. Refreshing citrus hops aroma. quite bitter, little malty balance. A hoppy brute.
Tap at Utrecht Bier Festival (one month ago): Amber coloured brew with an fine bitter taste and hints of caramel. Just a good starting brew of this newcomer.

Bottled @ Kafe Belgie. Currently brewed at the Proefbrouwerij I think, but they will be going to brew in Utrecht at their new brewery, which is currently being installed. Clear amber color, medium head. Lovely aroma of cascade, grapefruit, citrus, some caramel malt. Decent bitter taste. Very nice brew. The beer won its very first competition it entered: "best Utrecht beer" :-)
